sentences.english: No problem is permanent storms always give way to the sun.
sentences.chinese: 風暴總會給陽光讓路，寒冬總會轉變爲暖春。

sentences.english: and make that season of ice and snow more endurable.
sentences.chinese: 那歌聲使冰天雪地的寒冬變得較易忍受。

sentences.english: Whether day or night, summer or winter.
sentences.chinese: 不論白天黑夜，炎夏寒冬。

sentences.english: The chilly winter is far away and the spring is coming on.
sentences.chinese: 蕭索寒冬漸已遠去，春天飄然而至。

sentences.english: Many misfortunes came on us during that harsh winter.
sentences.chinese: 在那個嚴峻的寒冬，很多倒黴事都讓我們碰上了。

sentences.english: And make that season of ice and snow more endurable .
sentences.chinese: 那歌聲使冰天雪地的寒冬變得較易忍受。

sentences.english: You say, when the severe winter, will accompany me to see the flying snow.
sentences.chinese: 你說，待到寒冬臘月時，就陪我去看那場飛天雪地吧。

sentences.english: This lake usually freezes in the cold winter.
sentences.chinese: 這個湖泊在寒冬中常常結凍。

sentences.english: He loafed through the winter months.
Like the sun from a wintry sky.
Friendship is firewood in cold weather.
It was a cold winter's day that Sunday. The parking lot to the church was filling up quickly.
sentences.chinese: 那是個寒冬的星期天，教堂的停車場很快就車滿爲患。

sentences.english: Be like the sun and the meadow, which are not in the least concerned about the coming winter.
sentences.chinese: 要像陽光和草地那樣對寒冬的來臨全不在乎。

sentences.english: Pyongyang's harsh winter and shattered economy were obstacles too.
sentences.chinese: 平壤凌厲的寒冬以及破敗的經濟同樣成爲一大障礙。

sentences.english: Independentwinter, north wind blows, lonely Star.
sentences.chinese: 獨立寒冬，朔風蕭瑟，寂寞星空。

definition: cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
a world of ice and snow
